page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: ONE LARGE LANDOWNER OWNS 5000 ACRES OF LAND IN WOOTTON ST. LAWRENCE THE LAND IS DIVIDED UP INTO TWO PARTS. ONE HALF IS FOR MIXED CROPS SUCH AS WHEAT,BARLEY, PEAS AND BEANS.THE OTHER HALF IS USED FOR COWS AND CALVES.THEY DO NOT KEEP ANY SHEEP OR ANY OTHER FARM ANIMALS. THE FARM MANAGER LOOKS AFTER THE LAND. THE LAND WAS BOUGHT IN 1871 AND SINCE THEN IT HAS BEEN PASSED DOWN FROM GENERATION TO GENERATION. THEY ALSO OWN 75 COTTAGES WHICH ARE FOR ALL THE FARM WORKERS THAT WORK FOR THEM.THEY ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTAINING THESE COTTAGES.
